definition: to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)

sentences.english: This doesn’t mean that you should sit on your couch all day.
sentences.chinese: 当然这并不意味着你应该整天坐在沙发上无所事事。

sentences.english: There was no work in the office this afternoon so everyone idled about.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午办公室里没事干，所以大家都无所事事。

sentences.english: One worked all summer and the other sat on his duff.
sentences.chinese: 一个儿子整个夏季都在工作而另一个无所事事。

sentences.english: I am only interested in sitting in a boat and doing nothing at all.
sentences.chinese: 我只是对独坐孤舟无所事事感兴趣。

sentences.english: Buddha illuminates, safe and happy. Paradise on death.
sentences.chinese: 佛光普照，事事顺利，吉祥如意，幸福平安。

sentences.english: Without it, nothing could ever be brought to a conclusion; everything would be in state of chaos.
sentences.chinese: 不准时将一事无成，事事都会陷入混乱不堪的境地。

sentences.english: Her son is just bumming around.
sentences.chinese: 好的儿子总是无所事事。
别整天吊儿郎当无所事事。

sentences.english: He wasted a tolerably large allowance, something like three thousand francs a year, in doing nothing.
sentences.chinese: 他无所事事地吃着一笔相当大的学膳费，三千法郎。

sentences.english: Spend time on being excruciatingly clear.
sentences.chinese: 花时间做到事事一清二楚。

sentences.english: A complex creative intelligence with nothing to do is not just redundant.
sentences.chinese: 一个无所事事的复杂的创造性智慧不仅仅是多余的。

sentences.english: I can tell that your tired of being lonley.
sentences.chinese: 因为我能让事事顺心直到清晨。

sentences.english: Those teenagers just hang around the mall with nothing to do.
sentences.chinese: 那些年轻人只是在购物中心闲逛，无所事事。

sentences.english: I always congratulate friends when something goes their way.
sentences.chinese: 每逢我的朋友事事顺心的时候我总是祝贺他们。

sentences.english: One disadvantage of having nothing to do is you can't stop and rest. ----Franklin Jones.
sentences.chinese: 无所事事的缺点之一是你不能停下来休息。

definition: see 事無巨細|事无巨细[shi4 wu2 ju4 xi4]
to work/to handle matters/to have a job
to plan matters/to look for a job
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
lit. things are not separated according to their size (idiom)/fig. to deal with any matter, regardless of its importance
